Author: grumpygrumbles
Text: idk sounds like an oxygen issue to me - does this ever happen to your fingers or toes? could be Raynaud’s syndrome. it’s probs best you ask a doctor!!

Author: plantbasedbitchh
Text: yep it happens to meee! you might be anemic (i am) and i get constant blue lips and my hands are always cold. its because we also lack the fat to keep us warm lol. Try getting on one of those scales where it measures your fat and you can see how much body fat you have. anything less than 14% is vital fat so if you loose too much you can be at a bigger risk for being cold!
